{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory Accountant",
  "description": "Neveah Limited is a dynamic, fast-growing commodities trading and recycling company committed to excellence, sustainability, and global competitiveness.&nbsp;Since our establishment, we have evolved from a major player in commodity exports into a key stakeholder in Nigeria&rsquo;s industrial and environmental revolution.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	The Inventory Accountant will be responsible for monitoring, valuing, and reconciling inventory movements to ensure accurate financial reporting and strong internal control of stock.
	The role requires close collaboration with storekeepers, procurement, operations, and finance teams to ensure inventory integrity across all processes.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain and reconcile inventory records in ERP and accounting systems.
	Track all stock movements (receipts, issues, transfers, and adjustments).
	Perform monthly stock counts and variance analysis in collaboration with storekeepers.
	Monitor inventory valuation methods (FIFO, Weighted Average, etc.) to ensure compliance with IFRS.
	Review and report slow-moving, obsolete, or damaged stock.
	Liaise with procurement and operations teams to ensure inventory accuracy.
	Support cost accounting in preparing COGS and production-related reports.
	Enforce internal control procedures for material receipt, storage, and issuance.
	Prepare periodic inventory and consumption reports for management decision-making.
	Assist auditors during stock audits and year-end reviews.


SMART KPIs


	Inventory Reconciliation Accuracy: Maintain &ge; 99% accuracy in stock reconciliation.
	Stock Variance: Ensure monthly stock variance does not exceed &le; 1%.
	Reporting Timeliness: Submit monthly inventory reports within 3 working days after month-end.
	Audit Compliance: Achieve &ge; 95% compliance rating during internal and external stock audits.
	Obsolete Stock Monitoring: Identify and report &ge; 100% of slow-moving and obsolete stock within reporting timelines.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of post-graduate experience, with at least 3 years in a manufacturing environment.
	Must be a Chartered Accountant (ICAN, ACCA, or equivalent).
	Must reside in Lagos or Ogun State, within proximity to Mowe.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of inventory accounting, controls, and reconciliation.
	Proficiency in MS Excel and ERP/accounting software.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV saved in their full name to:&nbsp;careers@neveah.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only properly submitted applications and qualified candidates will be considered.",

  "validThrough": "2026-02-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

Inventory Accountant Job at Neveah Limited




        
    

        
        Neveah Limited is a dynamic, fast-growing commodities trading and recycling company committed to excellence, sustainability, and global competitiveness. Since our establishment, we have evolved from a major player in commodity exports into a key stakeholder in Nigeria’s industrial and environmental revolution.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Accountant

Job Location: Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	The Inventory Accountant will be responsible for monitoring, valuing, and reconciling inventory movements to ensure accurate financial reporting and strong internal control of stock.
	The role requires close collaboration with storekeepers, procurement, operations, and finance teams to ensure inventory integrity across all processes.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain and reconcile inventory records in ERP and accounting systems.
	Track all stock movements (receipts, issues, transfers, and adjustments).
	Perform monthly stock counts and variance analysis in collaboration with storekeepers.
	Monitor inventory valuation methods (FIFO, Weighted Average, etc.) to ensure compliance with IFRS.
	Review and report slow-moving, obsolete, or damaged stock.
	Liaise with procurement and operations teams to ensure inventory accuracy.
	Support cost accounting in preparing COGS and production-related reports.
	Enforce internal control procedures for material receipt, storage, and issuance.
	Prepare periodic inventory and consumption reports for management decision-making.
	Assist auditors during stock audits and year-end reviews.


SMART KPIs


	Inventory Reconciliation Accuracy: Maintain ≥ 99% accuracy in stock reconciliation.
	Stock Variance: Ensure monthly stock variance does not exceed ≤ 1%.
	Reporting Timeliness: Submit monthly inventory reports within 3 working days after month-end.
	Audit Compliance: Achieve ≥ 95% compliance rating during internal and external stock audits.
	Obsolete Stock Monitoring: Identify and report ≥ 100% of slow-moving and obsolete stock within reporting timelines.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of post-graduate experience, with at least 3 years in a manufacturing environment.
	Must be a Chartered Accountant (ICAN, ACCA, or equivalent).
	Must reside in Lagos or Ogun State, within proximity to Mowe.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of inventory accounting, controls, and reconciliation.
	Proficiency in MS Excel and ERP/accounting software.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV saved in their full name to: careers@neveah.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only properly submitted applications and qualified candidates will be considered.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Deloxe HR - Our client, an agro-allied manufacturing business, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR &amp; Administrative Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Okoja, Cross River&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	An agro-allied manufacturing business located in Ogoja, Cross River State is seeking a competent and experienced HR &amp; Administrative Officer to support factory operations and workforce management.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage day-to-day HR and administrative activities at the factory
	Handle recruitment, onboarding, attendance, and staff records
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, company policies, and factory regulations
	Support payroll inputs, leave management, and employee welfare
	Support performance management and disciplinary processes
	Oversee office administration, logistics, and facility support services
	Act as a liaison between management and employees.


Requirements / Skills


	Interested candidates should possess an HND or Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree
	Minimum of 2&ndash;4 years of HR/Admin experience, preferably in a manufacturing or agro-allied facility
	Strong understanding of HR operations in a factory environment
	Excellent organizational and communication skills
	Ability to work independently and handle confidential information
	Proficiency in MS Office and basic HR systems
	Proximity to Ogoja is mandatory.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV&nbsp; to:&nbsp;recruitment.globallinkers@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;HR &amp; Admin Officer&#39;&#39; as the subject of the mail.",

HR & Administrative Officer Job at Deloxe HR




        
    

        
        Deloxe HR - Our client, an agro-allied manufacturing business, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR & Administrative Officer

Job Location: Okoja, Cross River 
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	An agro-allied manufacturing business located in Ogoja, Cross River State is seeking a competent and experienced HR & Administrative Officer to support factory operations and workforce management.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage day-to-day HR and administrative activities at the factory
	Handle recruitment, onboarding, attendance, and staff records
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, company policies, and factory regulations
	Support payroll inputs, leave management, and employee welfare
	Support performance management and disciplinary processes
	Oversee office administration, logistics, and facility support services
	Act as a liaison between management and employees.


Requirements / Skills


	Interested candidates should possess an HND or Bachelor’s Degree
	Minimum of 2–4 years of HR/Admin experience, preferably in a manufacturing or agro-allied facility
	Strong understanding of HR operations in a factory environment
	Excellent organizational and communication skills
	Ability to work independently and handle confidential information
	Proficiency in MS Office and basic HR systems
	Proximity to Ogoja is mandatory.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV  to: recruitment.globallinkers@gmail.com using "HR & Admin Officer'' as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Logistics Manager",
  "description": "Greenlight Planet is a multinational, for-profit business that designs, distributes, and finances solar-powered home energy products, with an underserved population in mind: the 1.3 billion global consumers for whom the old-fashioned electrical grid is either unavailable or too expensive.

Over a decade in business, the company is now a leading global brand in emerging markets across Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.&nbsp; Greenlight&rsquo;s Sun King&trade; products provide modern light and energy to 26 million people in more than 40 countries and have sold over 10.5 million products worldwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos, Nigeria
Employment Type:&nbsp;Permanent - Full Time
Department:&nbsp;Operations
Workplace type:&nbsp;Onsite
Reporting To:&nbsp;Operations Manager, Nigeria

About the Role


	The Logistics Manager will&nbsp; oversee&nbsp; the monitoring and managing all transport related activities such as Transporters performance, truck utilization; deployment of trucks; back office.
	The role will focus on developing innovative solutions to some of the standard transport Operations management.&nbsp;
	The position is accountable for the implementation and management of the transport systems to optimize the performance of the transport operation, in a manner that is in line with the standards of Sun King Operations.


Responsibilities
Logistics strategy:


	Plan and manage end-to-end logistics operations, including transportation, and distribution.
	Provide accurate reporting and Interpretation of data to identify trends in monitoring of the activities of the dedicated Sun King trucks and other contracted trucks.
	Carrier Performance: Ensures dedicated transporters provide in a timely manner an adequate number of Service Resources to achieve the minimum trips/truck and cost savings in accordance with the provisions of the concurrence, the Service Specification and the Company&rsquo;s requirements.
	Scrutinize and evaluate vendors&rsquo; performance based on their performance metrics (KPIs).


Fleet Operations:


	Oversees the transportation operations of&nbsp; Sun King. The manager must monitor various activities of the department as well as the safe transportation of Sun King products from the company to the scheduled delivery location.
	Oversee the directing activities related to truck utilization, head the inbound and outbound logistics coordination for the business (across the warehouses and stores), dispatching, routing, or tracking transportation vehicles, transporters relationship management.
	Accountable for Managing approximately transporters and their fleet.
	Pilot investigation and resolution of issues surrounding delays, customer and transporter complaints across the business.
	Ensure transport department operational expenses are consistent with approved budgets.
	Journey management and Load Management with a view to develop our transporters to 5 star and promote safety management systems through transporters&rsquo; safety audits.
	Supervise&nbsp; Transport plan and capacity check on a weekly horizon as an output from Sales and Operations Planning.
	Conduct Management of Carrier Operational Performance


Team &amp; Vendor Management:


	&nbsp;Measure the general performance on the trucking strategy and fleet operations set KPI&rsquo;s against goals, assess the needed optimization, propose/question related action plans.
	Ensure proper communication of actions, related resolutions to all stakeholders
	Guide the expansion of dedicated service deliveries to all regional warehouses and ensure the success of this project.
	Coordinate regularly with stakeholders (sales, finance, programs, warehouse etc.)


Requirements
You might be a strong candidate if you:


	Have a Degree in a Business related field; a degree in logistics or transport management will be an added advantage.
	Minimum of 7 years of experience in logistics management, experience as a middle manager is an advantage
	Experience in managing teams and external contractors
	Strong comprehension of Supply Chain and its various functions as well as logistic process &amp;; scheduling.
	Ability to interpret financial data and estimate costs (data skills)
	Capability to drive Sun King safety standards within logistics and transportation activities.
	Operational mindset, Results oriented, customer oriented
	Good organization and planning skills
	Good oral and written communication skills


What Sun King Offers


	Professional growth in a dynamic, rapidly expanding, high-social-impact industry
	An open-minded, collaborative culture made up of enthusiastic colleagues who are driven by the challenge of innovation towards profound impact on people and the planet.
	A truly multicultural experience: you will have the chance to work with and learn from people from different geographies, nationalities, and backgrounds.
	Structured, tailored learning and development programs that help you become a better leader, manager, and professional through the Sun Center for Leadership.

Logistics Manager Job at Greenlight Planet




        
    

        
        Greenlight Planet is a multinational, for-profit business that designs, distributes, and finances solar-powered home energy products, with an underserved population in mind: the 1.3 billion global consumers for whom the old-fashioned electrical grid is either unavailable or too expensive.

Over a decade in business, the company is now a leading global brand in emerging markets across Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa.  Greenlight’s Sun King™ products provide modern light and energy to 26 million people in more than 40 countries and have sold over 10.5 million products worldwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time
Department: Operations
Workplace type: Onsite
Reporting To: Operations Manager, Nigeria

About the Role


	The Logistics Manager will  oversee  the monitoring and managing all transport related activities such as Transporters performance, truck utilization; deployment of trucks; back office.
	The role will focus on developing innovative solutions to some of the standard transport Operations management. 
	The position is accountable for the implementation and management of the transport systems to optimize the performance of the transport operation, in a manner that is in line with the standards of Sun King Operations.


Responsibilities
Logistics strategy:


	Plan and manage end-to-end logistics operations, including transportation, and distribution.
	Provide accurate reporting and Interpretation of data to identify trends in monitoring of the activities of the dedicated Sun King trucks and other contracted trucks.
	Carrier Performance: Ensures dedicated transporters provide in a timely manner an adequate number of Service Resources to achieve the minimum trips/truck and cost savings in accordance with the provisions of the concurrence, the Service Specification and the Company’s requirements.
	Scrutinize and evaluate vendors’ performance based on their performance metrics (KPIs).


Fleet Operations:


	Oversees the transportation operations of  Sun King. The manager must monitor various activities of the department as well as the safe transportation of Sun King products from the company to the scheduled delivery location.
	Oversee the directing activities related to truck utilization, head the inbound and outbound logistics coordination for the business (across the warehouses and stores), dispatching, routing, or tracking transportation vehicles, transporters relationship management.
	Accountable for Managing approximately transporters and their fleet.
	Pilot investigation and resolution of issues surrounding delays, customer and transporter complaints across the business.
	Ensure transport department operational expenses are consistent with approved budgets.
	Journey management and Load Management with a view to develop our transporters to 5 star and promote safety management systems through transporters’ safety audits.
	Supervise  Transport plan and capacity check on a weekly horizon as an output from Sales and Operations Planning.
	Conduct Management of Carrier Operational Performance


Team & Vendor Management:


	 Measure the general performance on the trucking strategy and fleet operations set KPI’s against goals, assess the needed optimization, propose/question related action plans.
	Ensure proper communication of actions, related resolutions to all stakeholders
	Guide the expansion of dedicated service deliveries to all regional warehouses and ensure the success of this project.
	Coordinate regularly with stakeholders (sales, finance, programs, warehouse etc.)


Requirements
You might be a strong candidate if you:


	Have a Degree in a Business related field; a degree in logistics or transport management will be an added advantage.
	Minimum of 7 years of experience in logistics management, experience as a middle manager is an advantage
	Experience in managing teams and external contractors
	Strong comprehension of Supply Chain and its various functions as well as logistic process &; scheduling.
	Ability to interpret financial data and estimate costs (data skills)
	Capability to drive Sun King safety standards within logistics and transportation activities.
	Operational mindset, Results oriented, customer oriented
	Good organization and planning skills
	Good oral and written communication skills


What Sun King Offers


	Professional growth in a dynamic, rapidly expanding, high-social-impact industry
	An open-minded, collaborative culture made up of enthusiastic colleagues who are driven by the challenge of innovation towards profound impact on people and the planet.
	A truly multicultural experience: you will have the chance to work with and learn from people from different geographies, nationalities, and backgrounds.
	Structured, tailored learning and development programs that help you become a better leader, manager, and professional through the Sun Center for Leadership.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

Front Desk Officer / Receptionist Job at JOJE Hospital Limited




        
    

        
        JOJE Hospital Limited is a specialist hospital with a specilaty in IVF, paediatrics, NICU, and render pharmacatical and laboratory services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer / Receptionist
Job Location: Apo, Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Answering of calls
	Welcoming of clients
	Keeping the workspace neat all the time
	Very punctual in work and also detailed in delivering services
	Attend to the client with a warm attitude
	Always ready to solve problems and keep to daily activities around the workspace
	Good communication skills.


Salary
N70,000 - N80,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrjojehospital@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Analyst",
  "description": "Konstructum Contracting Company (KCC) provides the essential infrastructure that powers the energy sector and supports export-focused industries. With over two decades of construction experience, we have built a reputation for being capable, quality-driven, and consistent. At KCC, we are BUILDing&mdash;not just structures, but a foundation of Balance, Understanding, Integrity, Leadership, and Delivery in every project. Our commitment to people and systems leadership ensures that we provide sustainable solutions that empower industries and communities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Analyst

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	The organization, a leading construction and EPC-IC company, is seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Procurement Analyst&nbsp;to support procurement operations, supplier management, and data-driven decision-making across all projects.
	This role is ideal for recent graduates or early-career professionals seeking hands-on experience in EPC procurement and project supply chain management.


Responsibilities


	Assist in processing purchase requisitions (PRs) and purchase orders (POs) in line with company and project procurement procedures.
	Support supplier onboarding, documentation collation, and compliance checks.
	Track procurement activities, including RFQs, supplier responses, approvals, deliveries, and project timelines.
	Maintain organized procurement records to support internal controls, audits, and project reporting.
	Collect, clean, and analyze procurement data related to spend, pricing, delivery performance, and supplier KPIs.
	Prepare regular procurement reports and dashboards using Excel and Power BI.
	Support ERP data updates, digital tracking tools, and reporting initiatives.
	Liaise with internal stakeholders (Projects, Engineering, Finance, and Accounts) to gather procurement-related information.
	Provide general administrative and coordination support to the Supply Chain team as required.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree or HND in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Engineering, Economics, IT, Data Analysis, or related discipline.
	NYSC completed or in progress (where applicable).
	1&ndash;2 year of experience in procurement, supply chain, administration, or related field; internship or industrial training is an advantage.
	Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel (formulas, pivot tables, basic data analysis) and familiarity with Power BI.
	Comfortable working with numbers, datasets, and ERP systems.
	Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to meet deadlines.
	Excellent communication and coordination skills; willingness to learn EPC procurement processes.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;talentmanagement@gsb-ng.comusing the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-30",

Procurement Analyst Job at Konstructum Contracting Company




        
    

        
        Konstructum Contracting Company (KCC) provides the essential infrastructure that powers the energy sector and supports export-focused industries. With over two decades of construction experience, we have built a reputation for being capable, quality-driven, and consistent. At KCC, we are BUILDing—not just structures, but a foundation of Balance, Understanding, Integrity, Leadership, and Delivery in every project. Our commitment to people and systems leadership ensures that we provide sustainable solutions that empower industries and communities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Analyst

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Description


	The organization, a leading construction and EPC-IC company, is seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Procurement Analyst to support procurement operations, supplier management, and data-driven decision-making across all projects.
	This role is ideal for recent graduates or early-career professionals seeking hands-on experience in EPC procurement and project supply chain management.


Responsibilities


	Assist in processing purchase requisitions (PRs) and purchase orders (POs) in line with company and project procurement procedures.
	Support supplier onboarding, documentation collation, and compliance checks.
	Track procurement activities, including RFQs, supplier responses, approvals, deliveries, and project timelines.
	Maintain organized procurement records to support internal controls, audits, and project reporting.
	Collect, clean, and analyze procurement data related to spend, pricing, delivery performance, and supplier KPIs.
	Prepare regular procurement reports and dashboards using Excel and Power BI.
	Support ERP data updates, digital tracking tools, and reporting initiatives.
	Liaise with internal stakeholders (Projects, Engineering, Finance, and Accounts) to gather procurement-related information.
	Provide general administrative and coordination support to the Supply Chain team as required.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree or HND in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Engineering, Economics, IT, Data Analysis, or related discipline.
	NYSC completed or in progress (where applicable).
	1–2 year of experience in procurement, supply chain, administration, or related field; internship or industrial training is an advantage.
	Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel (formulas, pivot tables, basic data analysis) and familiarity with Power BI.
	Comfortable working with numbers, datasets, and ERP systems.
	Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to meet deadlines.
	Excellent communication and coordination skills; willingness to learn EPC procurement processes.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talentmanagement@gsb-ng.comusing the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
